rComments: Dana is extremely likeable and easy to talk to.  Sometimes, though, her assignments were not as clear as I'd hoped, or when I did them as asked, the grade reflected something else (e.g., we were supposed to write a paper in the style of a "Rolling Stone" type film review, which I did, and then was criticized for not using citations).

Dana seems like a very nice person and she is funny at times. However, for stats I was bored out of my mind. If you read the book ahead, going to class is absolutely pointless except for attendance quizzes. Easiest class I have ever taken, but a waste of my time.

Dana was a breath of fresh air for me. She taught me to think very differently about sociology (being a mature student and in my last semester- i needed that. Helped me to think out-side-the-box, but also still developing my thinking months later- as i did the course almost 8 months ago now. I highly recommend for those wanting to think and grow.

True- difficult to know what she really wants from you. She tends to ramble in lectures. Readings can be dry and boring. However, she is very nice and actually an easy grader. Just make it look like you're making an honest attempt and you'll be fine.

HORRIBLE. never take her! completely disorganized!!! and COMPLETELY vague!!!!!!!! You are never sure what she wants from you and she gives you super hard material to work with. Had to write a paper on economics= not happy.

While Dana seems like a very cool person, I felt the organization of this class to be a bit scattered and hard to understand at times.  Her grading seemed rather inconsistent. It was often hard to figure out exactly what she expected, and when asked, she tended to give obtuse responses which basically equated to "you figure out."

Dana is nice and I'm sure she would be an awesome teacher for other sociology classes but she was terrible for Stats. She makes typos and mistakes on EVERYTHING often creating confusion. The final was messy with table printouts that confused the hell out of me. I got an A so I'm not just being mean, it really was bad.

The class was pretty easy and interesting (although I didn't learn much about social inequality). While she didn't talk too much about inequality, I did learn about other topics I hadn't previously given much thought to. Dana is funny and extremely nice, and I would recommend taking a class with her.

She is one of the kindesy professor you will ever meet. VERY HELPFUL AND SUPER NICE!!! when you come see her in office hours. Just read and discuss with her in class than your chances are ver high to pass.

She is a very nice and a helpful professor if you come to her office hours and ask for help. I think she awsome and understanding. I thought this class was going to be super hard but actually came easy to me even though i never took stats in my whole life. I recommend reading before lectures. Overall, i recommend this class with her.
hard class, she tried to make it easier, but ended up confusing us with some mistakes.  good effort, but soc majors hate math no matter what.
